channel.title: Data Science Portfolio on Alina Dovhalevska
channel.description: Recent content in Data Science Portfolio on Alina Dovhalevska

item.title: About
item.description: My academic journey has equipped me with a solid foundation in software engineering and a deep theoretical understanding of computer science. I have hands-on experience in working with data and employing various data analysis techniques. I am actively seeking a full-time position as a Data Scientist or Data Analyst, starting from September 2023. Education B.Sc. in Computer Science Technische Universität Berlin, Germany Graduated: 2018 – 2023 M.A. in Translation

item.title: Analysis on trends regarding the most-played games
item.description: With the bloom of global economics and the fast improvement of technology, not only children but also many adults consider playing video games on their computers as one of primary ways of entertainment and are willing to invest their time and money in it, so it’s no surprise that many companies want a piece of the gaming market, especially the market of PC gaming. Despite the growing competition in this field, a good choice of genres and a wise pick of release price can still make a PC game successful.

item.title: Analysis on weather in Berlin over the years
item.description: The project involved data cleaning, manipulation, merging, and visualization using Python’s pandas and seaborn libraries. It aimed to gain insights into temperature and humidity patterns in Berlin over various years. Results Concatenating Data Read temperature data for the years 1980, 1990, 2000, and 2010. Concatenated the data into a single dataframe. Groupby by Multiple Variables Calculated the average temperature per month and year using a groupby operation on multiple columns. Examined the resulting dataframe’s index object and reseted it to integers.
